page.title: 18RADCLIFFE 1909 - INTERVIEW
page.content: IN 1909 THERE WERE FEW CARS, MAINLY TRAMS AND HORSE DRAWN VEHICLES,WE PLAYED IN THE STREET - NOW AT 85,I'M AFRAID TO CROSS THE ROAD.HOUSES WERE RENTED FOR FOUR SHILLINGS (20p) A WEEK -THEY HAD NO BATH OR HOT WATER AND AN OUTSIDE TOILET.WE HAD FLAG FLOORS AND NO CARPETS.WE STARTED SCHOOL AT 3years WROTE ON SLATES AND DID A 6.5hour DAY. WE HAD NO BIG SHOPS - A VAN BROUGHT GREENGROCERY AND FISH.MILK CAME BY HORSE AND CART AND YOU FILLED YOUR JUG FROM THE CHURN. (A TROUP OF ENTERTAINERS STAYED FOR 1 MONTH - GAVE SHOWS TWICE WEEKLY - COST 1d.)THERE WERE 11 CHILDREN IN OUR FAMILY,WE WERE KEPT FOR 18 SHILLINGS(90p)/WEEK. I WENT TO WORK AT 12 YEARS - HALF TIME IN THE WEAVING MILLS- 6 a.m.-12 NOON FOR 6 DAYS FOR 4 SHILLINGS(20p.).
